sen.j: 延昌（えんしょう、元慶4年（880年） － 応和4年1月15日 (旧暦)（964年2月6日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Ensho (born 880, died January 15, 964 (old lunar calender) (February 6, 964) is a priest of the Tendai Sect in the middle of the Heian Era.
Ensho (born 880, died January 15, 964 (old lunar calender) (February 6, 964) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the middle of the Heian Era.
Ensho (880 - March 6, 964) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.e: He was born in Enuma-gun county, Kaga Province.
He was born in Enuma-gun county, Kaga Province.
He was born in Enuma-gun County, Kaga Province.
His shigo or posthumous title dedicated based on noble behaviors was Jinen.
His shigo or posthumous title, dedicated based on noble behavior, was Jinen.
His shigo (a posthumous name) was Jinen.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 幼い頃に出家し、比叡山に上って円仁の弟子である玄昭に師事して顕教・密教を学んだ。
sen.e: He became a priest in his childhood, and went to Hiei-zan Mountain to study kengyo (clearly explained teachings with language and words) and esoteric Buddhism under Gensho, a pupil of Enjin.
He became a priest in his childhood, and went to Hiei-zan Mountain to study kengyo (clearly explained teachings with language and words) and esoteric Buddhism under Gensho, a pupil of Enjin.
He became a priest in his childhood, and went to Mt. Hiei to study Exoteric Buddhism and Esoteric Buddhism under Gensho, a pupil of Enjin.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: また、長意から受戒している。
sen.e: He received religious precepts from Choi.
He received religious precepts from Choi.
He received religious precepts from Choi.

sen.j: その後は、毎日尊勝陀羅尼を誦読し、毎月15日には諸々の僧を招いて阿弥陀讃をとなえて極楽を祈願したとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that he later read aloud Sonshodarani every day and prayed for the realization of the paradise by chanting Amida-san with invited priests on the 15th of each month.
It is believed that he later read aloud Sonshodarani every day and prayed for the realization of paradise by chanting Amida-san with invited priests on the 15th of each month.

It is believed that he later read aloud Sonsho Dharani (Buddha-Crown Superb Victory Dharani) every day and prayed for the realization of paradise by chanting Amida-san (praise of Amida) with invited priests on the 15th of each month.

sen.j: 935年（承平 (日本)5年）法性寺阿闍梨、939年（天慶2年）法性寺座主、940年（天慶3年）内供奉十禅師、945年（天慶8年）律師、946年（天慶9年）天台座主と歴任し、958年（天徳 (日本)2年）には僧正に至った。
sen.e: He served as ajari (a high-ranking priest who instructs monks practicing asceticism) of Hossho-ji Temple in 935, zasu (a chief priest) of Hossho-ji Temple in 939, naikubu-juzenshi (one of the ten selected excellent priests for a Buddhist service in the Imperial Court) in 940, risshi (a Buddist priest) in 945 and tendai zasu (a head priest) in 946 before he became sojo (a Buddist high priest) in 958.

He served as ajari (high-ranking priest instructing monks practicing asceticism) of Hossho-ji Temple in 935, zasu (chief priest) of Hossho-ji Temple in 939, naikubu-juzenshi (one of the ten selected excellent priests for a Buddhist service in the Imperial Court) in 940, risshi (Buddist priest) in 945 and tendai zasu (head priest) in 946 before he became sojo (a Buddist high priest) in 958.

He served as ajari (high-ranking priest instructing monks practicing asceticism) of Hossho-ji Temple in 935, zasu (chief priest) of Hossho-ji Temple in 939, naikubu-juzenshi (one of the ten selected excellent priests for a Buddhist service in the Imperial Court) in 940, risshi (Buddhist priest) in 945 and Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) in 946 before he became sojo (a Buddhist high priest) in 958.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 朱雀天皇・村上天皇両天皇の帰依を受け、その師となった。
sen.e: When the Emperor Suzaku and the Emperor Murakami both became the believer in Buddism, he served as their mentor.
When Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami both became believers in Buddism, he served as their mentor.
When Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami both became believers in Buddhism, he served as their mentor.
